A brief description of your dataset including its provenance, dimensions, etc. as well as the reason why you chose this dataset.

title: Financial Analysis of long term care services for the elderly beings
text:
Source:
Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services

title: Financial Analysis of long term care services for the elderly beings
text:
How it was originally collected:
The National Health Expenditure Accounts (NHEA) are the official estimates of total health care spending in the United States. Dating back to 1960, the NHEA measures annual U.S. expenditures for health care goods and services, public health activities, government administration, the net cost of health insurance, and investment related to health care. The data are presented by type of service, sources of funding, and type of sponsor.

title: Financial Analysis of long term care services for the elderly beings
text:
Brief description:
There are about 544 rows and 64 columns in the dataset which accounts the data from 1960 to 2022 and the data sets show a detailed trend of various social expenditure on medicare from individual to government levels.

title: Financial Analysis of long term care services for the elderly beings
text:
Ethical Concerns:
Nothing Specific

title: Financial Analysis of long term care services for the elderly beings
text:
Questions:

If medical expenditure gets bigger as age increases, what are the sources of income and/or average income of that old age group?
Along with the population demographic data of US, what can we predict to happen in next 15-20 years?
How many percent of the population will be able to support themselves with proper medical treatment after retirement? what can individuals and governments do about it?

The two questions you want to answer.
If medical expenditure gets bigger as age increases, what are the sources of income and/or average income of that old age group?
How many percent of the population will be able to support themselves with proper medical treatment after retirement? what can individuals and governments do about it?
There are much options for categorical data

title: Financial Analysis of long term care services for the elderly beings
section: Statement on why this question is important.
text:
Statement on why this question is important.
The aging population is a global trend for most the developed countries all over the world. asking and answering these research questions is valuable because they address critical issues related to aging, healthcare costs, and financial sustainability in retirement.
Predicting demographic trends over the next 15-20 years enables governments and businesses to proactively plan for shifts in labor markets, healthcare demand, and resource allocation. Finally, examining how many people can afford proper medical treatment after retirement highlights the need for both individuals and governments to take action, such as improving pension systems, enhancing healthcare access, and promoting financial preparedness, which are all essential for ensuring a healthier and more secure aging population.

title: Financial Analysis of long term care services for the elderly beings
section: A description of the research topic along with a concise statement of your hypotheses on this topic.
text:
A description of the research topic along with a concise statement of your hypotheses on this topic.

Medical expenditures for the elderly will significantly increase with age, and this group’s primary income sources will be insufficient to cover these expenses, leading to a financial strain fully.
Demographic data will show a rapid increase in the elderly population in the US over the next 15-20 years, resulting in heightened demand for healthcare services, increased dependency ratios, and pressure on pension systems.
A significant portion of the population will be unable to afford adequate medical treatment after retirement, necessitating policy interventions and increased individual financial planning to address this gap.

title: Financial Analysis of long term care services for the elderly beings
text:
Analysis plan

A plan for answering each of the questions including the variables involved, variables to be created (if any), external data to be merged in (if any).


Trend Analysis of Total National Health Expenditures
Impact of Health Insurance on Expenditure
Out-of-Pocket Expenditures Analysis
Government vs. Private Expenditures
Expenditures on Different Services
Impact of Recessions on Health Expenditures
Forecasting Future Expenditures.

text:
Math Expressions
You can write LaTeX math expressions inside a pair of dollar signs, e.g. $\alpha+\beta$ renders \(\alpha + \beta\). You can use the display style with double dollar signs:
$$\bar{X}=\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^nX_i$$
\[
\bar{X}=\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^nX_i
\]
Limitations:

The source code of a LaTeX math expression must be in one line, unless it is inside a pair of double dollar signs, in which case the starting $$ must appear in the very beginning of a line, followed immediately by a non-space character, and the ending $$ must be at the end of a line, led by a non-space character;
There should not be spaces after the opening $ or before the closing $.

text:
Feeling adventurous?

You are welcomed to use the default styling of the slides. In fact, that’s what I expect majority of you will do. You will differentiate yourself with the content of your presentation.
But some of you might want to play around with slide styling. Some solutions for this can be found at https://quarto.org/docs/presentations/revealjs.
